Function Documentation

CSL_Status HID_Close ( pHidAppClassHandle  pAppClassHandle)

============================================================================
HID_Close

Description
This function Closes the Hid class module.

Arguments 

            pAppClassHandle       Application handle to the Hid Class Obj

Return Value CSL_Status

  • CSL_SOK - Returned for success
  • CSL_ESYS_BADHANDLE - Invalid Hid class handle

Pre Condition
HID_Open function should be called successfully

Post Condition
Closes the Hid Class module

Modifies
Hid and Ctl handles

Example 

            CSL_HidInitStructApp    hidAppHandle;
            pHidAppClassHandle      pAppClassHandle;
            Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
            CSL_Status             status;

            pAppClassHandle = &hidAppHandle;

            // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
            hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
            .....
            .....
            status = HID_Open(pAppClassHandle);
            ....
            ....
            status = HID_Close(pAppClassHandle);

============================================================================

CSL_Status HID_Ctrl ( void *  pHidObj)

============================================================================
HID_Ctrl

Description
This function handles all USB traffic on the Control Endpoint. Detects the events on the Control Endpoint and takes the appropriate action

Arguments 

            pHidObj        Handle to the Hid Class Obj

Return Value CSL_Status

  • CSL_SOK - Returned for success
  • CSL_ESYS_BADHANDLE - Invalid Hid class handle
  • CSL_HID_INVALID_REQUEST_HANDLER - Invalid request class handler

Pre Condition
HID_Open function should be called successfully

Post Condition
Control end point events are serviced

Modifies
USB Registers.

Example 

            CSL_HidInitStructApp    hidAppHandle;
            pHidAppClassHandle      pAppClassHandle;
            Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
            CSL_Status             status;

            pAppClassHandle = &hidAppHandle;

            // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
            hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
            .....
            .....
            status = HID_Open(pAppClassHandle);
            ....
            ....
            status = HID_Ctrl(pAppClassHandle->pHidObj);

============================================================================

void HID_eventHandler ( pUsbContext  pContext,
pHidAppClassHandle  pHidAppHandle,
CSL_UsbSetupStruct *  usbSetUp 
)

============================================================================
HID_eventHandler

Description
This function handles all HID data transactions

Arguments 

			pContext		 Pointer to the USBContext structure
            hHidClass        Handle to the HID Class Obj
            usbSetUp         Structure to hold the USB Set up Values that were
                             used to configure the USB End Point

Return Value - Status of the processing (CSL_Status)

  • CSL_SOK (0) Success
  • CSL_ESYS_FAIL (-1) Generic failure
  • CSL_ESYS_BADHANDLE (-5) Handle passed to CSL was invalid
  • CSL_ESYS_INVPARAMS (-6) Invalid parameters

Pre Condition
HID module should be opened using HID_Open function

Post Condition
Returns request processing status

Modifies
None

Example 

			CSL_HidInitStructApp    pHidAppHandle;
			CSL_HidClassStruct      hidClassStruct;
			CSL_UsbSetupStruct      usbSetUp;
			CSL_Status              status;

			// Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
			hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidClassStruct;
			.....
			.....
			status = HID_Open(pHidAppHandle);
			....
			....

			in USB ISR:
			....
			....
			if (pContext->dwIntSourceL & (1<<CSL_USB_IN_EP0))
			{
				// Handle the HID Event
				HID_eventHandler(pContext, &pHidAppHandle, &usbSetUp);
			}
			....
			....

============================================================================

CSL_Status HID_initDescriptors ( void *  pHidObj,
Uint16 *  descBuf,
CSL_HidDescrId  descrId,
Uint16  descrLen 
)

============================================================================
HID_initDescriptors

Description
This function initializes the descriptors used by the USB Hid class

Arguments 

            pHidObj      Hid Class object
            descBuf     Descriptor buffer pointer
            descrId     Id of the Descriptor to initialize
            descrLen    Length of the descriptor to initialize (in bytes)

Return Value CSL_Status

  • CSL_SOK - Returned for success
  • CSL_ESYS_BADHANDLE - Invalid Ctrl handle
  • CSL_ESYS_INVPARAMS - Invalid parameter

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
Initializes descriptors

Modifies
Descriptor buffers

Example 

            CSL_HidInitStructApp    hidAppHandle;
            pHidAppClassHandle      pAppClassHandle;
            Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
            CSL_Status             status;

            pAppClassHandle = &hidAppHandle;

            // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
            hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];

            status = HID_initDescriptors(pAppClassHandle->pHidObj,
                                        CSL_HID_DEVICE_DESCR, 18);

============================================================================

static CSL_Status HID_initVal ( CSL_HidObject *  phidHandle) [static]

============================================================================
HID_initHidVal

Description
This function initializes the Hid Class object

Arguments 

            phidHandle        Handle to the Hid class Object

Return Value CSL_Status

  • CSL_SOK - Returned for success
  • CSL_ESYS_BADHANDLE - Invalid Hid class handle

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
Initializes Hid Class object

Modifies
Hid Class object structure

Example 

            CSL_HidObject    hidObj;
            CSL_Status      status;

            status = HID_initHidVal(&hidObj);

============================================================================

static fpHID_REQ_HANDLER HID_lookupReqHandler ( Uint16  request,
CSL_HidRequestStruct *  pUSB_ReqTable 
) [inline, static]

============================================================================
HID_lookupReqHandler

Description
This functions maps the request sent by host to the Hid request table and returns the correspending request handler address

Arguments 

            request        -  Request sent by the host
            pUSB_ReqTable  -  Request table structure pointer

Return Value
Request handler pointer

Pre Condition
Request table should be initialized and HID_Open function should be called successfully

Post Condition
Returns the request handler pointer

Modifies
None

Example 

             CSL_HidRequestRet      (*fpRequestHandler)(CSL_HID_REQUEST_ARGS)
             CSL_HidInitStructApp   hidAppHandle;
             CSL_HidObject          *phidHandle;
             CSL_HidCtrlObject      *pCtrlHandle;
             CSL_UsbEpHandle        hUbOutEp;
             Uint16                 lunNum;
             Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
             CSL_Status             status;
             Uint16                 request;

             // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
             hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
             .....
             .....
             status = HID_Open(&hidAppHandle);
             ....
             ....
             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler = HID_lookupReqHandler(request,
                                                       pCtrlHandle->hidReqTable);

============================================================================

References CSL_HidRequestStruct::fpRequestHandler, and HID_reqUnknown().

CSL_Status HID_Open ( pHidAppClassHandle  pAppClassHandle,
CSL_UsbConfig *  usbConfig 
)

============================================================================
HID_Open

Description
This function Opens the Hid class module. It initializes Hid and Ctrl handles with the data given by the application

Arguments 

            pAppClassHandle      Application handle to the Hid Class Obj

Return Value CSL_Status

  • CSL_SOK - Returned for success
  • CSL_ESYS_BADHANDLE - Invalid Hid class handle

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
Initializes Hid and Ctrl handles

Modifies
Hid and Ctrl handle data

Example 

            CSL_HidInitStructApp    hidAppHandle;
            pHidAppClassHandle      pAppClassHandle;
            Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
            CSL_Status             status;

            pAppClassHandle = &hidAppHandle;

            // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
            hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
            .....
            .....
            status = HID_Open(pAppClassHandle);

============================================================================

CSL_Status HID_reportHandler ( void *  pHidObj)

============================================================================
HID_reportHandler

Description
This function handles all USB traffic on the HID Interrupt Endpoint. Detects the events on the HID Endpoint and takes the appropriate action

Arguments 

            pHidObj        Handle to the Hid Class Obj

Return Value CSL_Status

  • CSL_SOK - Returned for success
  • CSL_ESYS_BADHANDLE - Invalid Hid class handle
  • CSL_HID_INVALID_REQUEST_HANDLER - Invalid request class handler

Pre Condition
HID_Open function should be called successfully

Post Condition
HID interrupt end point events are serviced

Modifies
USB Registers.

Example 

            CSL_HidInitStructApp    hidAppHandle;
            pHidAppClassHandle      pAppClassHandle;
            Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
            CSL_Status             status;

            pAppClassHandle = &hidAppHandle;

            // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
            hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
            .....
            .....
            status = HID_Open(pAppClassHandle);
            ....
            ....
            status = HID_reportHandler(pAppClassHandle->pHidObj);

============================================================================

static CSL_HidRequestRet HID_reqClearFeature ( CSL_UsbDevHandle  devHandle,
CSL_UsbSetupStruct *  usbSetup,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hInEp,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hOutEp,
void *  pHidObj 
) [inline, static]

============================================================================
HID_reqClearFeature

Description
This function handles the request to clear the feature set

Arguments 

            devNum       - USB device number
            usbSetup     - USb setup structure
            hInEp        - USB ISO In end point handle
            hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object
            pHidObj       - USB Hid Class object

Return Value

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_SEND_ACK - Send acknowledgement for request
  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_STALL - Request stall signal (Error)

Pre Condition
HID_lookupReqHandler should be called successfully

Post Condition
Clears the feature

Modifies
USB registers

Example 

             CSL_HidInitStructApp   hidAppHandle;
             CSL_HidObject          *phidHandle;
             CSL_HidCtrlObject      *pCtrlHandle;
             CSL_UsbEpHandle        hUbOutEp;
             Uint16                 lunNum;
             Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
             CSL_Status             status;
             Uint16                 request;

             // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
             hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
             .....
             .....
             status = HID_Open(&hidAppHandle);
             ....
             ....
             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler = HID_lookupReqHandler(request,
                                                       pCtrlHandle->hidReqTable);

             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler(pCtrlHandle->devNum,
                                           &pCtrlHandle->usbSetup,hCtrlEpIn,hCtrlEpOut,pHidObj);

============================================================================

References CSL_USB_FEATURE_ENDPOINT_STALL, CSL_USB_FEATURE_REMOTE_WAKEUP, CSL_UsbContext::hEpHandleArray, USB_clearEndptStall(), USB_setRemoteWakeup(), and CSL_UsbSetupStruct::wValue.

static CSL_HidRequestRet HID_reqGetConfiguration ( CSL_UsbDevHandle  devHandle,
CSL_UsbSetupStruct *  usbSetup,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hInEp,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hOutEp,
void *  pHidObj 
) [inline, static]

============================================================================
HID_reqGetConfiguration

Description
This function handles the request from host to get configuration

Arguments 

            devNum       - USB device number
            usbSetup     - USb setup structure
            hInEp        - USB ISO In end point handle
            hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object
            pHidObj       - USB Hid Class object

Return Value

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_GET_ACK - Get acknowledgement for request

Pre Condition
HID_lookupReqHandler should be called successfully

Post Condition
Sends the configuration

Modifies
None

Example 

             CSL_HidInitStructApp   hidAppHandle;
             CSL_HidObject          *phidHandle;
             CSL_HidCtrlObject      *pCtrlHandle;
             CSL_UsbEpHandle        hUbOutEp;
             Uint16                 lunNum;
             Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
             CSL_Status             status;
             Uint16                 request;

             // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
             hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
             .....
             .....
             status = HID_Open(&hidAppHandle);
             ....
             ....
             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler = HID_lookupReqHandler(request,
                                                       pCtrlHandle->hidReqTable);

             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler(pCtrlHandle->devNum,
                                           &pCtrlHandle->usbSetup,hCtrlEpIn,hCtrlEpOut,pHidObj);

============================================================================

References CSL_USB_IN_TRANSFER, CSL_HidCtrlObject::ctrlBuffer, CSL_HidClassStruct::ctrlHandle, CSL_HidCtrlObject::curConfigStat, and USB_postTransaction().

CSL_UsbSetupStruct *  usbSetup,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hInEp,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hOutEp,
void *  pHidObj 
) [inline, static]

============================================================================
HID_reqGetDescriptor

Description
This function handles the request from host to get the descriptor

Arguments 

            CSL_HID_REQUEST_ARGS    - HID request arguments

Return Value

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_GET_ACK - Get acknowledgement for request\
  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_STALL - Request stall signal (Error)

Pre Condition
HID_lookupReqHandler should be called successfully

Post Condition
Sends the descriptor

Modifies
None

Example 

             CSL_HidInitStructApp   hidAppHandle;
             CSL_HidObject          *phidHandle;
             CSL_HidCtrlObject      *pCtrlHandle;
             CSL_UsbEpHandle        hUbOutEp;
             Uint16                 lunNum;
             Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
             CSL_Status             status;
             Uint16                 request;

             // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
             hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
             .....
             .....
             status = HID_Open(&hidAppHandle);
             ....
             ....
             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler = HID_lookupReqHandler(request,
                                                       pCtrlHandle->hidReqTable);

             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler(pCtrlHandle->devNum,
                                           &pCtrlHandle->usbSetup,hCtrlEpIn,hCtrlEpOut,pHID);

static CSL_HidRequestRet HID_reqGetInterface ( CSL_UsbDevHandle  devHandle,
CSL_UsbSetupStruct *  usbSetup,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hInEp,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hOutEp,
void *  pHidObj 
) [inline, static]

============================================================================
HID_reqGetInterface

Description
This function handles the request from host to get interafce unit number

Arguments 

             devNum       - USB device number
             usbSetup     - USb setup structure
             hInEp        - USB ISO In end point handle
             hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object
             pHidObj       - USB Hid Class object

Return Value

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_GET_ACK - Get acknowledgement for request\
  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_STALL - Request stall signal (Error)

Pre Condition
HID_lookupReqHandler should be called successfully

Post Condition
Sends interface info

Modifies
None

Example 

             CSL_HidInitStructApp   hidAppHandle;
             CSL_HidObject          *phidHandle;
             CSL_HidCtrlObject      *pCtrlHandle;
             CSL_UsbEpHandle        hUbOutEp;
             Uint16                 lunNum;
             Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
             CSL_Status             status;
             Uint16                 request;

             // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
             hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
             .....
             .....
             status = HID_Open(&hidAppHandle);
             ....
             ....
             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler = HID_lookupReqHandler(request,
                                                       pCtrlHandle->hidReqTable);

             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler(pCtrlHandle->devNum,
                                           &pCtrlHandle->usbSetup,hCtrlEpIn,hCtrlEpOut,pHidObj);

============================================================================

References CSL_USB_IOFLAG_NONE, CSL_HidCtrlObject::ctrlBuffer, CSL_HidClassStruct::ctrlHandle, USB_postTransaction(), CSL_UsbSetupStruct::wIndex, CSL_UsbSetupStruct::wLength, and CSL_UsbSetupStruct::wValue.

CSL_UsbSetupStruct *  usbSetup,

void *  pHidObj 
) [inline, static]

============================================================================
HID_reqGetMaxLUN

Description
This function handles the request from host to send maximum logical unit number

Arguments 

             devNum       - USB device number
             usbSetup     - USb setup structure
             hInEp        - USB ISO In end point handle
             hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object
             pHidObj       - USB Hid Class object

Return Value

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_GET_ACK - Get acknowledgement for request\
  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_STALL - Request stall signal (Error)

Pre Condition
HID_lookupReqHandler should be called successfully

Post Condition
Sends the max lun number

Modifies
None

Example 

             CSL_HidInitStructApp   hidAppHandle;
             CSL_HidObject          *phidHandle;
             CSL_HidCtrlObject      *pCtrlHandle;
             CSL_UsbEpHandle        hUbOutEp;
             Uint16                 lunNum;
             Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
             CSL_Status             status;
             Uint16                 request;

             // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
             hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
             .....
             .....
             status = HID_Open(&hidAppHandle);
             ....
             ....
             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler = HID_lookupReqHandler(request,
                                                       pCtrlHandle->hidReqTable);

             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler(pCtrlHandle->devNum,
                                           &pCtrlHandle->usbSetup,hCtrlEpIn,hCtrlEpOut,pHidObj);

============================================================================

HID_reqGetStatus

Description
This function handles the get status request from host

Arguments

            usbSetup     - USb setup structure

            hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object

CSL_HidRequestRet HID_reqHidGetReport ( CSL_UsbDevHandle  devHandle,
CSL_UsbSetupStruct *  usbSetup,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hInEp,
CSL_UsbEpHandle  hOutEp,
void *  pHidObj 
)

============================================================================
HID_reqHidGetReport

Description
This function handles the request from host to get HID report

Arguments 

             devNum       - USB device number
             usbSetup     - USb setup structure
             hInEp        - USB ISO In end point handle
             hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object
             pHidObj       - USB Hid Class object

Return Value

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_SEND_ACK - Send acknowledgement for request
  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_STALL - Request stall signal (Error)

Pre Condition
HID_lookupReqHandler should be called successfully

Post Condition
Sends acknowledgement

Modifies
None

Example 

             CSL_HidInitStructApp   hidAppHandle;
             CSL_HidObject          *phidHandle;
             CSL_HidCtrlObject      *pCtrlHandle;
             CSL_UsbEpHandle        hUbOutEp;
             Uint16                 lunNum;
             Uint16                 hidAppBuffer[420];
             CSL_Status             status;
             Uint16                 request;

             // Assign values to all the members in hidAppHandle struct
             hidAppHandle.pHidObj = &hidAppBuffer[0];
             .....
             .....
             status = HID_Open(&hidAppHandle);
             ....
             ....
             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler = HID_lookupReqHandler(request,
                                                       pCtrlHandle->hidReqTable);

             pCtrlHandle->fpRequestHandler(pCtrlHandle->devNum,
                                           &pCtrlHandle->usbSetup,hCtrlEpIn,hCtrlEpOut,pHidObj);

HID_reqSetAddress

Description
This function handles the request to set the device address

Arguments 

            devNum       - USB device number
            usbSetup     - USb setup structure
            hInEp        - USB ISO In end point handle
            hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object
            pHidObj       - USB Hid Class object

Return Value

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_DONE - Request hadled successfully

Pre Condition
HID_lookupReqHandler should be called successfully

Post Condition
Sets the device address

Modifies
USB FADDR_POWER register

HID_reqUnknown

Description
This function handles the case where the request sent by the host is unknown unit number

Arguments 

            devNum       - USB device number
            usbSetup     - USb setup structure
            hInEp        - USB ISO In end point handle
            hOutEp       - USB ISO Out end point object
            pHidObj       - USB Hid Class object

  • CSL_HID_REQUEST_STALL - Request stall signal (Error)
